name: Priority: Critical
description: This should be dealt with ASAP. Not fixing this issue would be a serious error

name: Priority: High
description: After critical issues are fixed, these should be dealt with before any further issues

name: Priority: Medium
description: This issue may be useful, and needs some attention

name: Priority: Low
description: This issue can probably be picked up by anyone looking to contribute to the project, as an entry fix

name: Status: Abandoned
description: The issue or Pull Request is wontfix

name: Status: Blocked
description: Progress on the issue is Blocked

name: Status: In Progress
description: Work in Progress

name: Status: Proposal
description: Request for comments

name: Status: PR Welcome
description: Welcome to Pull Request

name: Status: Review Needed
description: Request for review comments

name: Status: Need More Info
description: Lacks enough info to make progress

name: Type: Breaking Change
description: Includes breaking changes

name: Type: Bug
description: Bug or Bug fixes

name: Type: Documentation
description: Documentation only changes

name: Type: Feature
description: Most issues will probably ask for additions or changes

name: Type: Refactoring
description: A code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature

name: Type: Testing
description: Adding missing tests or correcting existing tests

name: Type: Maintenance
description: Changes to make things clearer or removing ambiguity, without changing functionality

name: Type: CI
description: Changes to CI configuration files and scripts

name: Type: Question
description: A query or seeking clarification on parts of the spec.

name: Type: Discussion
description: Discussion thread about changes or decisions

name: Type: Epic
description: A theme of work that contain sub-tasks

name: ¯\_[ツ]_/¯
description: It's no longer possible to determine what the actual issue is about anymore

name: [ノಠ益ಠ]ノ彡┻━┻
description: It seems impossible for people to agree on this issue
